attributes.content: 2:25 P.M. \ Clear
Rathaus parlor, nomadic town Wolumonde, Leithanien
What can we do?
Who could have thought they would value a wedding more than a town that has produced so much for them?
The Great Rift caused tremendous damage, although we avoided any casualties. The fact that Wolumonde lost a full quarter of its land area is a concern...
What can we do?
Come in.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Looks like your wounds have healed well.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Wipe that 'we’re all going to die' look off your face. Keep an open mind for once.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: You can stay here and rest. There’s always room for someone to cause trouble in the Rathaus parlor.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: What of my home?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: It’s bad. You don’t want to know.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Tell me.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: The locks were broken. Everything inside smashed. Nothing intact but your safe.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Of course, it’s not that they left it alone. They just couldn’t break it. High temperature heat marks all over it.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Hope they enjoyed it.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Strange. Are you very attached to your home?
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: How is it that I’ve lived in that house for years, but everyone still calls me 'outsider?'
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: It’s not like that. We’re a trade town. There’s no xenophobia in Wolumonde. It’s just...
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: I’m allergic to smoke.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Oh, okay.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: But take my advice: don’t show your face out there. It was just a flesh wound this time. But who knows what they have in store for you next.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: You know there are no Gendarmerie stationed in Wolumonde right now. And Tatjana’s men are only a militia at best. No one can control them if things really get out of hand.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: You made a stupid mistake too, Severin.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: I didn’t know one wedding could go on for so long.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: All right, get some rest. That’s all.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: It’s not your fault. We all know that.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Catastrophes can’t be accurately predicted...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Neither can man-made tragedies.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Alright, you feel better now.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Think about what comes next.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: What comes next.
I can already guess what comes next.
The Great Rift perfectly sealed off all routes to the southeast, and Wolumonde could only push north.
If the other towns can’t provide help in time, winter will come, and we’ll starve.
Starve...
So many will die, I...
No, it’s not my fault.
This isn’t my fault.
Seven days later...
Hello? Anyone there?
I heard Wolumonde’s Catastrophe Messenger is staying here? Anyone?
It’s a voice I’ve never heard before. A young lady.
And she knows I’m a Catastrophe Messenger.
Severin is right. I shouldn’t show my face.
So it’s better if I just pretend I’m not here.
Dr. Atro, Biederman hasn’t been seen for days.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: That makes sense. After the way those people beat him like that, I wouldn’t expect to see much of him either.
R- right... Say, what are you doing?
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: Kicking the door down?
Huh?
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: Huh?
I may not look like much, but I can kill an Originium slug with my bare hands!
Biederman, you’re in there, aren’t you? I don’t know the layout of the room, but do step away from the door!
If you can’t avoid it, just block. Cross your arms!
Hyah!
Rhodes Island Operator Atro.
She came to me without a second thought, seeking my help.
Why... why should I help her?
What good is it to have a makeshift clinic to treat the Infected in a doomed town?
Right... she’s taking advantage of my guilt. She has no other use for a disgraced Catastrophe Messenger like me.
I have no reason to refuse. And Severin makes it clear that this is an opportunity to improve my reputation with the townsfolk.
I guess. At least, that’s what I tell myself.
So I go.
It’s late.
Why do I have to work so hard...?
Um...
attributes.name: Tatjana

attributes.content: See? They still look at me like I’m a plague.
Biederman... Thank you for helping Thor and Uncle Severin.
attributes.name: Tatjana

attributes.content: So many traveling merchants couldn’t escape the Catastrophe and ended up trapped in Wolumonde. We really need help from someone like you, who knows about Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Tatjana

attributes.content: Some stupid townsfolk have done bad things, I know. But you’ve been here a long time, Biederman. You must understand.
attributes.name: Tatjana

attributes.content: Please get some rest.
attributes.name: Tatjana

attributes.content: What... was that?
Whatever.
I have to help Atro move boxes tomorrow. I’d better turn in early today.
Hey, Biederman. You’re working hard. It’s doing a lot to help us clear up those nasty rumors.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: I told you I was allergic to cigarette smoke.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Your private space is upstairs. This is the common area.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Did you say you’re clearing up the rumors?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: To help you out.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Tangentially, I’d like you to help us too. After all, Dr. Atro is an outsider, and you’re one of us.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Maybe I count for half.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Sure, fine. We’ll be implementing an emergency supply rationing program soon, but...
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: There’s a problem with the supplies in Zwölftontechnik Strasse.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: We have a lot of new Infected refugees, mostly merchants and travelers who couldn’t escape the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: They couldn’t get over the Great Rift. It’s full of active Originium crystals. They had no choice but to catch up to the town.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: Wolumonde doesn’t have enough to feed all those mouths...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: We couldn’t just leave them to die.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: So we took them all over to Zwölftontechnik Strasse for now. For housing, they’re getting by in makeshift tents, but food...
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: We still have to prioritize our legal residents of Wolumonde. And then, it’s only humanitarian relief.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: That’s reasonable. They’ll understand.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Will they? I hope so.
attributes.name: Severin

attributes.content: A letter? Who’s been in my room? Severin?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: It’s...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Contingency Contract?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Who’s there?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Don’t open the door. Just listen to me.
What else do you need from me, after all this?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Hey now, don’t be so on edge. We’re just trying to salvage the situation.
Look, I didn’t do so well either. I should have come to Wolumonde sooner. And I failed.
What were you trying to do?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: What I should have done was dealt with that wedding problem to make sure Wolumonde had the manpower to deal with a Catastrophe.
But that’s all in the past. Let’s talk about the present.
Whatever. I know your plan. But you didn’t need to call me.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: So... you know that Infected doctor pretty well.
You don’t mean...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Wow, your mind goes straight to the darkest place, huh? I told you, you should have agreed.
You can’t drag innocent people into your plan like this! Atro’s a good doctor!
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: I know, of course. Who hasn’t been shackled by morality and conscience?
But we’re out of options now. At least we can be sure that, after this, Wolumonde will get enough 'attention.'
You want to get Rhodes Island over here?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Oh no... Rhodes Island doesn’t even rank, at least on the surface, among our many partners.
We can’t expect them to save an entire town.
Then... you just want a riot.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: I need something to bring to the Spire, and only by lighting a fire on the ground can we get those ignorant nobles to see the tragedy over here.
*Sigh*, sometimes I can’t tell if they’re so corrupt that they don’t care about the plight of the people, or if they’re just so far off the ground that they can’t even see it.
B-but that will kill a lot of people...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: A lot of people will die if we do nothing too. When things get a little worse for Wolumonde, there will be plenty of reasons for this already troubled town to implode.
Not to mention, there’s a rather unusual group of Infected floating around Wolumonde. They’re armed, they’re rebels, and they’re bound to bring a fight.
And so, it’s up to us to carve a path that gets as few people killed as possible.
Don’t worry. We don’t have to the dirty work ourselves. Maybe a jealous youth, maybe a stubborn cobbler. Then, all it takes is a spark to light the fire...
Hey!
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: This is an opportunity to atone for your sins. Lead the rebellion.
Damn it... How can you just hide behind a curtain and watch innocent people suffer?!
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Hey, this is an easy moral choice to make. I won’t even hesitate. Not for a second.
Unless I’m killing all the good guys to save all the bad guys. But lord knows who’s good and who’s bad.
What’s more, don’t get me wrong. I’m not going to hide behind a curtain and pay lip service to sacrifice when I’m not willing to die myself. What kind of conspirator would I be?
I know the deal. I deserve to die. This will be my one, final sacrifice. I’ll give myself closure.
I’m going to die in this riot. I’ve earned it.
Are you crazy?!
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Oh, right, and if you agree to participate, you’re going to die too.

But don’t worry. But any objective measure, you will have helped Wolumonde. You’ll have atoned for your sins, and subjectively paid for your crimes with your own death. Two for one. Pretty great deal, huh?
And like I said, you won’t even have to kill the Infected yourself. Your biggest crime will be 'conspiracy' or 'aiding and abetting.' It’s nothing.
Everyone sins. For some, it’s a sin of omission. So many people sin that way...
They’re all so nice until they realize it. That’s when they turn desperate.
So I’ll make it a lot easier and just kill myself.
Think about it.
It’s all about saving lives. More lives.
Wait!
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: I open the door, but no one is there.
There are ice crystals on the ground. It looks like it wasn’t easy to get here. His plan in the nearby city had mostly failed.
But, I don’t care much about his earlier plans. He’s not going after Rhodes Island on his own. But he is right.
Wolumonde is very unstable right now.
All about... saving more lives.
Why do I have to do this?
This wasn’t my fault in the first place. And Dr. Atro is good to me. I don’t need to atone for some dumb hypothetical...
I... I don’t need to. Right. There won’t be any uprising. Wolumonde will get through this.
I have to help Dr. Atro move boxes tomorrow... and I’ll tell her about it tomorrow. As long as there’s no mass uprising, everything he said was just bullshit.
But if... if these people do start some kind of civil war over famine and cold...I have to...
No, at least she can be spared. There’s no need to make a sacrifice of Dr. Atro.
Right.
Oh. Right.
So you didn’t leave. You’re like a ghost.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: If that Infected doctor were to die... What would become of your interpersonal relationships, and your work?
If you want to stir up trouble, you can do it without Atro’s death.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Ooh... will you help me? You really don’t want anything to happen to that doctor, do you?
But I will warn you one more time.
The death of the Infected is not something I would arrange. It is just a consequence of which I am absolutely certain. Sooner or later, someone will do something about them.
Don’t look at me like that. It’s not like you can’t save that doctor, if you really want to.
How are you so certain that things are going to go in the worst possible direction, Thor? You’ve always been such a nice boy.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Because it has to happen. It won’t be the first time either. Before, I just watched. But now I’m in it.
You should talk to your father, and the little girl with you. You shouldn’t be so...
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: What a humanitarian you are. I suggest you glue yourself to that doctor.
Anyway... you can underestimate me. I went to great lengths just to escape my pursuers.
Heh. Covering myself with ice Arts in the freezing snow, nearly killing myself with my own Originium Arts.
But don’t underestimate the violence brewing in Wolumonde. The worst possible violence.
Oh... are you going to kill me?
No, you’re not. When the time comes, in order to get one side to compromise as quickly as possible, you will offer to help the other side.
I don’t need to, Thorwald. No matter who you have in mind, you’re now an accomplice to a capital crime.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: Well... You can watch what happens then. But not now.
And I have you to thank for that. My original idea was just to hand 'this' over to some indignant non-infected and wait for something to happen.
That’s the core of an Arts unit. Where did you get it?
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: The Gramophone. That Gramophone. You see it?
When it’s done, I’ll be waiting there for you.
At my grave. Ha ha... it’s so close.
You’re scared.
attributes.name: Biederman

attributes.content: I’m always scared.
